snippet: The author of a 1996 United Nations report on women forced into prostitution during World War II has refused to retract part of the study, a Japanese government spokesman has said.
abstract: Japanese government has asked for partial retraction of 1996 United Nations report on Korean and other women forced to work in Japanese military brothels during World War II; report's author, former UN official Radhika Coomaraswamy, refuses request.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: The author of a 1996 United Nations report on women forced into prostitution during World War II has refused to retract part of the study, a Japanese government spokesman has said.

headline.main: Japan, Seeking Revision of Report on Wartime Brothels, Is Rebuffed
headline.print_headline: Japan, Seeking Revision of Report on Wartime Brothels, Is Rebuffed
